intro: Conostephium, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. These plants typically grow in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to harsh environmental conditions. They are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow, orange, and red. Conostephium species often have hairy leaves and stems, which help reduce water loss. The genus includes several species, many of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
